definition[0]: to try to hold, move, or find something with your hands in an awkward way
example[0]: She reached round to fumble the light on.
example[1]: She dressed, her cold fingers fumbling with the buttons.
example[2]: I fumbled around in my bag for a cigarette.
definition[1]: if you fumble with your words when you are speaking, you have difficulty saying something
example[3]: The second candidate fumbled her lines.
example[4]: Asked for an explanation, Mike had fumbled for words.
definition[2]: to drop a ball after catching it
example[5]: Quarterback Rattay was hit and fumbled the ball.
